title: Connectome predictive modelling in R
text: simple use package. Just shape connectivity matrix subjects edges matrix, .e., row contains correlation matrix (removed diagonal duplicated values, e.g., lower triangular data) subject, behavior data vector feed cpm() function.
code: library(cpmr)  withr::local_seed(123) conmat <- matrix(rnorm(100 * 1000), nrow = 100) behav <- rnorm(100) res <- cpm(conmat, behav, kfolds = 10) plot(res$real, res$pred[, "both"], xlab = "Real", ylab = "Predicted")

title: Perform Connectome-based Predictive Modeling (CPM) — cpm
text: connectome-based predictive modeling (CPM) data-driven approach predict individual behavior brain connectivity data. Originally proposed Shen et al. (2017), CPM widely used various studies. function implements CPM algorithm provides convenient interface use .

title: Perform Connectome-based Predictive Modeling (CPM) — cpm
code: cpm(   conmat,   behav,   ...,   confounds = NULL,   thresh_method = c("alpha", "sparsity"),   thresh_level = 0.01,   kfolds = NULL,   bias_correct = TRUE )

title: Perform Connectome-based Predictive Modeling (CPM) — cpm
text: conmat matrix connectome data. Observations row, edges column (assumed duplicated edges removed). behav numeric vector contains behavior data. Length must equal number observations conmat. ... future extension. Currently ignored. confounds matrix confounding variables. Observations row, variables column. NULL, confounding variables used. thresh_method, thresh_level threshold method level used edge selection. method set "alpha", edge selection based critical value correlation coefficient. method set "sparsity", edge selection based quantile correlation coefficient, thus network sparsity controlled. kfolds Folds number cross-validation. NULL, set equal number observations, .e., leave-one-subject-. bias_correct Logical value indicating connectome data bias-corrected. TRUE, connectome data centered scaled unit variance based training data model fitting prediction. See Rapuano et al. (2020) details.

title: Perform Connectome-based Predictive Modeling (CPM) — cpm
text: list following components: folds corresponding fold observation used test group cross-validation. real real behavior data. input behav. pred predicted behavior data, column corresponding model, .e., edges, positive edges, negative edges, row names corresponding observation names (behav). edges selected edges, 3D array indicating selction results fold. Dimensions folds, edges, networks.

title: Perform Connectome-based Predictive Modeling (CPM) — cpm
code: conmat <- matrix(rnorm(100 * 100), nrow = 100) behav <- rnorm(100) cpm(conmat, behav) #> CPM results based on leave-one-out cross validation. # use different threshold method and level cpm(conmat, behav, thresh_method = "sparsity", thresh_level = 0.05) #> CPM results based on leave-one-out cross validation. # use a 10-fold cross-validation cpm(conmat, behav, kfolds = 10) #> CPM results based on 10-fold cross validation.
